intro: Phalangium ramosum, commonly known as the branched phalangium, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
